question: I send some amount every month to them. Can this me considered as Zakat
answer:
QUESTION

I live in canada and I send every month some amount to a widow in pakistan, this widow has 1 daughter and a widow daugter in law and no one to earn for them. So I send some amount every month to them. Can this me considered as Zakat. My wife says that this cannot be considered Zakat, as Zakat has to be given at a certain time of the year (Ramadan)? Please clear this confusion.

ANSWER


Share:

If you give the money to the widow and her widow daughter-in-law with the intention of Zakaat, it is permissible. The Zakaat will be discharged.

Zakaat can be discharged any time in the year. It does not have to be discharged in Ramadhaan.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
